senses.de: A word or phrase used to describe a thing or to express a concept
senses.ex: In mathematical terms, 'pi' stands for a constant value.

Tips.title: Subject-Specific
Tips.description: Some terms have different meanings in specific subjects like science or art.
Tips.example: In art, the term 'medium' refers to materials used by an artist.

Tips.title: Understanding Concepts
Tips.description: Use terms to comprehend and discuss complex concepts more easily.
Tips.example: Understanding the term 'sustainability' is key to discussing environmental issues.

senses.de: A fixed period of time during which something lasts or is supposed to happen
senses.ex: Students should submit their assignments before the end of term.

Tips.title: Relative Time
Tips.description: A term can indicate a specific part within a time frame, like a season or academic term.
Tips.example: The fall term is often from September to December.

senses.de: Each of the periods a school or university year is divided into
senses.ex: I have four courses this term.

Tips.title: Breaks Inbetween
Tips.description: Academic terms are typically separated by holidays or vacation breaks.
Tips.example: There is a week-long break between the spring and summer term.

Tips.title: Varied Lengths
Tips.description: Not all academic terms have the same length; some may last weeks, others months.
Tips.example: This term, my course lasts for ten weeks.

senses.de: A condition or requirement in a legal agreement
senses.ex: The terms of the contract were clear and binding.

Tips.title: Clause Importance
Tips.description: Each term in a legal document is significant and can affect rights and obligations.
Tips.example: Review every term in the lease to understand your responsibilities.

senses.de: A word or phrase used in a specific field of study or profession
senses.ex: Genome is a biological term for the genetic material of an organism.

Tips.title: Precision In Language
Tips.description: Professional terms provide precision and clarity in communication within that field.
Tips.example: The term 'bypass surgery' is specific to cardiac procedures.

Tips.title: Confusion With Slang
Tips.description: Don't confuse technical terms with similar-sounding slang or colloquial language.
Tips.example: The computing term 'cookie' is different from the snack you eat.

Definition.wordDefinition:
A definition is the explanation or meaning of a term. It tells us what the term means and helps us understand it better.

For example, the definition of "apple" could be "a sweet and juicy fruit with a round shape and red, green, or yellow skin."

A term is the word or phrase used to represent something, while its definition is the explanation of what that term means.

Designate.wordDefinition:
Designate means to assign a specific name or purpose to something. For example, a teacher may designate a certain desk as the student's seating arrangement for the rest of the school year.

Designate is more specific, while term is more general.

Duration.wordDefinition:
Duration refers to the length of time something lasts or continues for, while term is a specific period of time that is assigned to something.

For example, if you were talking about a movie, the duration would be the length of time the movie runs for (e.g. 2 hours), while the term would be when the movie is released and available to watch (e.g.

In simpler terms, duration is the length of time something goes on for, while term is a specific period of time that something is scheduled to happen or exist for.

Expression.wordDefinition:
In mathematics, an expression is a group of numbers or variables that are combined using mathematical operations (e.g. addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) to form a mathematical phrase.

An expression can contain one or more terms.

A term is a part of an expression that is separated by a plus or minus sign.

For example, in the expression 3x + y - 2, there are three terms: 3x, y, and -2. The expression is made up of these three terms, with the addition and subtraction signs indicating how the terms are combined.

So, expressions are a collection of terms that can be combined to form mathematical equations, while terms are the individual parts that make up an expression.

Label.wordDefinition:
Label refers to a specific name or tag given to something to identify it. For example, we label our belongings so that we know what they are and where they belong.

In the same way, we use labels to categorize things, such as food packaging or medicine bottles.

A label is like a name tag, while a term is like a description. Labels are used to identify specific things, while terms are used to describe broader categories or concepts.

Name.wordDefinition:
Name refers to a specific word or set of words that is used to identify a person, place, or thing. For example, the name "John" is used to refer to a specific person.

The name "New York" is used to refer to a specific city. Names are used in everyday communication to help identify and refer to people, places, or things.

Name is used to identify people, places, or things, while term is used in specific fields to refer to words or phrases that have a certain meaning.

Period.wordDefinition:
The words period and term can both refer to a specific amount of time, but they have slightly different meanings and uses.

Period typically refers to a broader span of time, such as a certain era or historical time period. For example, the Middle Ages or the Victorian era are both periods of time in history.

Period can also refer to a recurring segment of time, such as a menstrual period.

In legal and contractual contexts, term refers to a set period of time during which an agreement or a commitment will be in effect.

Period describes a larger or more general span of time, while term refers to a specific and defined length of time for a certain purpose.

Phrase.wordDefinition:
A phrase is a group of words that are used together but do not form a complete sentence. For example, "the big red apple" is a phrase.

A phrase can be used in a sentence to add more detail and information.

A phrase is a group of words used together in a sentence, while a term is a specific word or group of words used to describe something in a particular field or subject.

Title.wordDefinition:
Title refers to the name of a book, movie, or other creative work. It is applicable in situations where a work needs to be named in order to identify it.

For example, 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' is the title of a popular book.

A term is a specific word or phrase used to describe something, while a title is the name of a creative work.

Word.wordDefinition:
Word is a unit of language consisting of one or more sounds or letters that typically has meaning and is spoken, written or signed.

Term on the other hand has a more specific definition. It refers to a word or phrase that has a particular meaning in a specific context.

Word is a more general term used to describe the basic units of language while term is a more specific term used to describe a word or phrase with a particular meaning in a specific context or a limited period of time.

quotes.Text: There are necessary evils. Money is an important thing in terms of representing freedom in our world. And now I have a daughter to think about. It's really the first time I've thought about the future and what it could be.

quotes.Text: I think our democracy has it exactly right: two terms, eight years. It's enough. Because it's important to have one foot in reality when you have access to this kind of power.

quotes.Text: The 'Third World' is a term I don't like very much because we're all one world. I want people to know that the largest part of humanity is suffering.

quotes.Name: Audrey Hepburn

quotes.Text: Wall Street' was a very important movie for me in terms of my career. I won an Oscar, and then the film 'Fatal Attraction' came right after it.

quotes.Text: Everybody wants respect. In their own way, three-year-olds would like respect, and acknowledgment, in their terms.

quotes.Text: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.

quotes.Name: Saint Teresa of Avila

quotes.Text: I try not to think of my life in terms of separation.

quotes.Text: Women are so necessary for us in terms of support.

quotes.Text: Who ever lives life on their own terms?

quotes.Text: I have lived life on my own terms.
